channel.title: Facing south
channel.description: Soo all my shop and other npc are always facing south ... I need help to make them face north :)[br][size=1]Posted on: June 19, 2007, 02:03:30 PM[/size][hr]Help me plz :([br][size=1]Posted on: June 19, 2007, 06:29:45 PM[/size][hr]Y no one is helping me?!

item.title: Facing south
item.dc:creator: @AD_LVL_7 AD LVL 7
item.description:
@AD_LVL_7 wrote:

i dont care:

no its -1 -2 -3 -4

no, n’either that.
0: West
-1: North
-2: East
-3: South

I think you could try and do something with ‘NPC update masks’

cheese8:

Could someone maybe find a way to edit that? It has something to do with “view” and “face”

that has to do with attack, but good to see you tried to solve someones prob =p

Read full topic

item.title: Facing south
item.dc:creator: @cheese8 cheese8
item.description:
@cheese8 wrote:

I found this is npcHanlder:

if(server.playerHandler.players[Player].attacknpc == NPCID) { server.playerHandler.players[Player].faceNPC = NPCID; // Xerozcheez: sets npc index for player to view server.playerHandler.players[Player].faceNPCupdate = true; // Xerozcheez: updates face npc index so player faces npcs server.playerHandler.players[Player].attacknpc = NPCID; // Xerozcheez: makes it so if player runs away the player attacks back when npc follows server.playerHandler.players[Player].IsAttackingNPC = true; // Xerozcheez: makes it so if player runs away the player attacks back when npc follows }

Could someone maybe find a way to edit that? It has something to do with “view” and “face”

Read full topic

item.title: Facing south
item.dc:creator: @HPC_Jarod HPC_Jarod
item.description:
@HPC_Jarod wrote:

[size=8pt]
Let me see…Its been a long time since i have ever coded a server, so all details might not be right.
[/size]
Go into your ncp file where you add all your ncp’s to your server.
There should be 1 digit numbers that go up to 4

think these are right, not really sure though:
North: 1
East: 2
West: 3
South: 4

[size=8pt]Once again…Not really sure about the numbers, but i know now that there should be a 1 digit # area.[/size]

Read full topic
